Text.Value: A merregon mask, no less. Hells' footsoldiers - their bodies disintegrate, leaving only these behind.
It belonged to a merregon. They dissolve upon death, leaving only their masks behind.
Merregon's mask. When they die, they just kind of vanish. All but the mask.
The mask was a merregon's. Infernal warriors who disintegrate upon death.
Wait, this is a merregon's mask. Warriors of the Nine Hells - they disintegrate when they die.
A merregon's mask, I wager. Hell's soldiers. When they die, their bodies just... melt away.
This belonged to a merregon - one of Hell's footsoldiers. Their corpses dissolve when they die.

EditorData.logicalname: TO BE ACTIVATED POST PATCH 6 Planar characters passed arcana check

Text.Value: Gods, how many masks are there?
It's mask after mask in here.
Yet one more.
A mask. Just like the others.
Still another one.
And another mask. How many are there?
Another mask.
Sadly, 'cute' alone isn't worth much.
Oh well, a minor mystery it must remain.
I must have skipped the chapter on these at school.
I've never encountered such a thing, even in wildspace.
Perhaps the creatures of the Underdark had a masquerade ball. I'd like to see that.
Who would make a metal mask like this? Or wear it?
I don't know the alloy. Perhaps it came from the surface.
I've never seen anything like it.
Still only merregon remains, though. Whatever commanded them, I'm not sure it's dead.
Merely merregons, however. Their commander might still be at large.
Leader might still be around here. Eyes up.
I suppose the merregons' master returned to the Hells. Unless...
Whatever commanded these merregons didn't die here. Let's hope it returned to the Hells.
Whatever commanded the merregons, I hope it's long gone.
The merregons' leader might still be around here.

EditorData.logicalname: Surmised earlier the merregons were led by some sort of general

Text.Value: A merregon mask, no less. Hells' footsoldiers.
It belonged to a merregon. Infernal soldiers.
I'd know it anywhere. It's a merregon's mask. Infernal warriors.
The mask was a merregon's - an infernal warrior.
Wait, this is a merregon's mask. Warriors of the Nine Hells.
A merregon's mask, I wager. Hell's soldiers.
This belonged to a merregon - one of Hell's footsoldiers.
It's surprisingly heavy. Style over practicality, I suppose.
It's heavier than I thought. Must have been strong creatures that wore them.
Awfully heavy. That's infernal metal for you.
An unusual metal. Too heavy to wear comfortably.
Heavy. And nothing to hold it in place.
It's surprisingly heavy. How would you secure it?
Heavier than it looks. Wouldn't be very comfortable.
The longer you look at them, the more unsettling they get.
They unsettle somehow - as if they harbour a lingering presence.
They've got the heft of infernal metal to them.
My teachings say nothing of them. They could be meaningless trinkets.
Not duergar handiwork, anyway.
Creepy. I swear the eyes follow me around.
The more I find, the more curious I get.
A whole gaggle of merregons. They never fight alone, though - where's their commander?
This place was rife with merregons. And they never travel without a commander...
This place was rotten with merregons. Their leader probably isn't far off.
Hmm - a merregon's, most likely. An infernal battle was fought here. But what of the commander?
A merregon's mask, no less. Those infernal soldiers only fight with a commander at their side - and I don't see one here...
Wait. It's a merregon's - an infernal soldier's. And they don't fight without a commander...
I recognise this. A merregon wore it. But they won't fight without a commander...

EditorData.logicalname: Passed arcana check, knows these are merregon masks

Text.Value: A curious mask. It's almost cute.
Interesting mask. I quite like the design.
Strange mask. Looks familiar, but I can't quite place it.
Odd. What manner of mask is this?
What a curious mask...
What a strange mask. Is it bronze? Gold, even?
Belongs to a Merregon, if I recall correctly. Hell's footsoldiers - I don't fancy meeting the commander.
Curious mask. What's it doing here?
Another mask.

Synopsis:
Player discovers a merregon's mask. Note: It is only ever player 1 talking, so you can be linear!

Merregons are infernal warriors that wear metallic masks that are screwed to their faces and only come off after death.
